p: As expected, adaptation to mosquito cells deeply modified the relative abundance of each virus ( Fig 7). By two viral passages, the frequency of CHIKV-LR changed from 90% to less than 10% ( Fig 7A), while the frequency of the chimeric virus increased from 10% to 80%. In addition, new viruses with 3’UTRs of intermediate length arose in cell culture with a frequency of 20%. Similar results were obtained when CHIKV-Cbn was mixed with the chimeric virus carrying the 3’UTR from CHIKV-LR in a 1:9 ratio ( Fig 7B). The parental CHIKV-Cbn completely displaced the Cbn/3’LR after two passages and viral variants with 3’UTRs of intermediate lengths appeared with a frequency of about 20%.
